translated: The six that are the opposite of those are the opposite of the six that are to be abandoned: not to analyze, not to transcend the objects of the weapons of the five senses, not to meditate, not to transcend the three‚Äîthe pristine consciousness that arises, the field-born, and the mantra-born‚Äînot to transcend the bliss and emptiness of manifest diligence, andüîΩto meditate on the bliss that is simultaneously born with that.

analyzed: phan yon gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third benefit.

original: // / gang zhig spyod pa byed pa de'i tshe 'di las brtsams te skye ba thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa dang mi 'bral zhing /üîΩmngon bar dga' ba'am /
analyzed: // / gang zhig spyod pa byed pa de'i tshe 'di las brtsams te skye ba thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa dang mi 'bral zhing / mngon bar dga' ba'am /
translated: When one performs the conduct, beginning from this, in all lives one will not be separated from the tathƒÅgatas,üîΩand one will be reborn in Abhirati

original: bde ba can du skye bar 'gyur ba phan yon bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba can du skye bar 'gyur ba phan yon bzhi pa'o //
translated: or SukhƒÅvatƒ´. This is the fourth benefit.

original: de ltar sa dang po thob nas 'jig rten pa'i rgyal po chen po bzhi dang phyogs skyong ba bcu la gtor ma byin nas sems can gyi don byed pa'i phrin las rnam pa bzhi 'chol ba'i gtor ma'i cho ga ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro nas bshad pa bzhin
analyzed: de ltar sa dang po thob nas 'jig rten pa'i rgyal po chen po bzhi dang phyogs skyong ba bcu la gtor ma byin nas sems can gyi don byed pa'i phrin las rnam pa bzhi 'chol ba'i gtor ma'i cho ga ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro nas bshad pa bzhin
translated: Having thus attained the first ground, one should perform the ritual of the torma offering to the four great worldly kings and the ten direction protectors and request them to carry out the four types of enlightened activities that benefit sentient beings.üîΩThis torma ritual should be performed in accordance with the Vajradaka Tantra.

original: du bya'o // de ltar sa dang po rang don rdzogs nas sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa nas sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin gyi bar gyis gzhan don gyi spyod pa bslab pa ni /
analyzed: du bya'o // de ltar sa dang po rang don rdzogs nas sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa nas sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin gyi bar gyis gzhan don gyi spyod pa bslab pa ni /
translated: Having thus perfected one's own goal on the first ground, the second ground, The Stainless, up to the tenth ground, The Cloud of Dharma, one trains in the conduct for the benefit of others.

original: zag med kyi mchod pa rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: zag med kyi mchod pa rnam par dag pa /
translated: This is the pure, untainted offering.

original: sprul pa byung ba rnams /
analyzed: sprul pa byung ba rnams /
translated: The emanations that appear

original: yan lag drug cu sems kyis sprul nas /
analyzed: yan lag drug cu sems kyis sprul nas /
translated: are emanated by the mind with sixty aspects.

original: bdag nyid gtso bor byas pa dang mchod pa dang / bum pa bzhi sangs rgyas sogs kyi yum bzhi dang sras dang bcas pa dpa' bo nyi shu @210b rtsa bzhi dang / rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa drug brten pa gzhal yas khang sbrul pa dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid gtso bor byas pa dang mchod pa dang / bum pa bzhi sangs rgyas sogs kyi yum bzhi dang sras dang bcas pa dpa' bo nyi shu @210b rtsa bzhi dang / rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa drug brten pa gzhal yas khang sbrul pa dang /
translated: The self-empowerment is the main one, and the four vases are the four mothers of the buddhas and so on, together with the sons, the twenty-four heroes, and the thirty-six yoginƒ´s.üîΩ

original: g-yo ba lha'i spun dang sdug pa dang / dpa' bo dang dpa' mo la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba lha'i spun dang sdug pa dang / dpa' bo dang dpa' mo la mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should worship the self as the principal, the four vases, the four mothers of the Buddha and so forth, together with the sons, the twenty-four heroes, and the thirty-six yoginis, the celestial mansion which is the supported, and the emanation of the moving gods, the brothers, the beloved, the heroes, and the heroines.

original: rdul tshon dang / gzugs brnyan dang / lha'i cha byad byas pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum las 'das pa'i sgra'i tshul nges par 'byung ba /
analyzed: rdul tshon dang / gzugs brnyan dang / lha'i cha byad byas pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum las 'das pa'i sgra'i tshul nges par 'byung ba /
translated: The three mandalas of colored powder, image, and divine form are the means of expression of the transcendent,

original: dam tshig spyod pa'i spyod yul can //
analyzed: dam tshig spyod pa'i spyod yul can //
translated: the domain of the conduct of the commitments.

original: zhes bya ba sa bcu'i dbang phyug gi dkyil 'khor yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba sa bcu'i dbang phyug gi dkyil 'khor yin no //
translated: This is the mandala of the lord of the tenth stage.

original: de ltar mdor bstan nas brgyad par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan nas brgyad par bshad pa ni /
translated: Having thus summarized, the explanation of the eighth chapter is:

original: zla ba'i 'dus pa mngon sum gyi las 'dir 'jig rten pa'i spun dang / bu la sogs pa la bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'dus pa mngon sum gyi las 'dir 'jig rten pa'i spun dang / bu la sogs pa la bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: This assembly of the moon should not be taught to worldly brothers, sons, and so forth.

original: sngags sgyu ma lta bu dang / phyag rgya 'od gsal ba bsgom pa yang bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sngags sgyu ma lta bu dang / phyag rgya 'od gsal ba bsgom pa yang bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not teach the mantra which is like an illusion, nor the seal which is the meditation on clear light.

original: su la bstan zhe na /
analyzed: su la bstan zhe na /
translated: To whom should it be taught?

original: dam tshig dang ldan pa la dag byed kyis zas tshogs 'khor dang / sngags sgyu ma lta bu dang / man ngag 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: dam tshig dang ldan pa la dag byed kyis zas tshogs 'khor dang / sngags sgyu ma lta bu dang / man ngag 'od gsal ba /
translated: To one who has the commitments, the food of the ga·πáacakra, the mantra which is like an illusion, and the esoteric instruction which is clear light.

original: gnas ci rigs pa'i dbang bskur ba thob pa la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas ci rigs pa'i dbang bskur ba thob pa la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: It should be given to one who has received the consecration in the appropriate place.

original: blang dor gyi gang zag bshad nas /
analyzed: blang dor gyi gang zag bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the person who should adopt and reject,

original: mchod pa dngos bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mchod pa dngos bshad pa ni /
translated: the actual worship is explained.

original: pho nya gsum ma gtogs pa yul gzhan dang sems bde ba stong pa ma gtogs pa 'dod chags dang gti mug la sogs pa bsgom par mi bya'o //
analyzed: pho nya gsum ma gtogs pa yul gzhan dang sems bde ba stong pa ma gtogs pa 'dod chags dang gti mug la sogs pa bsgom par mi bya'o //
translated: Except for the three messengers, one should not meditate on other objects, and except for the bliss of the mind, one should not meditate on desire, ignorance, and so on.

original: thar pa sa bcu 'dod pas pho nya 'dus ma byas bsrung /
analyzed: thar pa sa bcu 'dod pas pho nya 'dus ma byas bsrung /
translated: One who desires the ten stages of liberation should protect the messenger who is unconditioned.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags bzhin du 'dus ma byas dang / mi 'da' ba'i longs spyod bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags bzhin du 'dus ma byas dang / mi 'da' ba'i longs spyod bya'o //
translated: Like the bodhisattva Dharmodgata, one should enjoy the unconditioned and not pass beyond.

original: pho nya ma ma gtogs pa gzhan su zhe na /
analyzed: pho nya ma ma gtogs pa gzhan su zhe na /
translated: Except for the messenger, who is the other?

original: skye gnas dman pa bsam gtan dang zag med las ma skyes pas 'dod pa'i khams kyi lus la bsnyen bkur gyi mchod pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: skye gnas dman pa bsam gtan dang zag med las ma skyes pas 'dod pa'i khams kyi lus la bsnyen bkur gyi mchod pa mi bya'o //
translated: The inferior birth is not born from the dhyana and uncontaminated, so one should not make offerings of service to the body of the desire realm.

original: bsrung ba'i pho nya gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsrung ba'i pho nya gang zhe na /
translated: What is the messenger of protection?

original: 'dus ma byas thob pa'i ma dang sring mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas thob pa'i ma dang sring mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the mother, sister, and so on who obtain the unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas de'i 'bras bu ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas de'i 'bras bu ci zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that unconditioned?

original: rgya che ba lha'i 'khor lo dang / zab pa bzhin du stong pa nyid 'grub bo //
analyzed: rgya che ba lha'i 'khor lo dang / zab pa bzhin du stong pa nyid 'grub bo //
translated: The vast is the wheel of the gods, and the profound is the accomplishment of emptiness.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi skye gnas dman pa la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi skye gnas dman pa la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault of the inferior birth in the desire realm?

original: bsam gtan dang zag med kyi dka' thub zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang zag med kyi dka' thub zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ascetic practices of dhyana and uncontaminated will be exhausted.

original: bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen lta bu dang / rtag tu ngu'i tshong dpon gyi bu mo bzhin du lhan cig snyom par zhugs pas 'dus ma byas kyi ye shes 'dren par bye pa de ltar rdzas rgyu rkyen tshogs pa rnam par nges pa gtan la phab pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen lta bu dang / rtag tu ngu'i tshong dpon gyi bu mo bzhin du lhan cig snyom par zhugs pas 'dus ma byas kyi ye shes 'dren par bye pa de ltar rdzas rgyu rkyen tshogs pa rnam par nges pa gtan la phab pa yin no //
translated: Like the daughter of Bhadra the merchant and like Sadaprarudita the son of a merchant, by entering into union, the unconditioned wisdom is drawn forth. Thus, the ascertainment of the definite collection of substantial causes and conditions is established.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi mchod pa @211a * //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi mchod pa @211a * //
translated: Having explained the worship of others,

original: bshad nas / brtul zhugs ni rnal 'byor la rtag tu du bde ba stong pa nyid kyis spyod /
analyzed: bshad nas / brtul zhugs ni rnal 'byor la rtag tu du bde ba stong pa nyid kyis spyod /
translated: the conduct is always to practice yoga with the bliss of emptiness.

original: rkang pa bde stong gi ched du 'dor lag pa bde stong gi ched du bsgyur g-yon pa'i phyed bde bas mchod /
analyzed: rkang pa bde stong gi ched du 'dor lag pa bde stong gi ched du bsgyur g-yon pa'i phyed bde bas mchod /
translated: For the sake of the bliss and emptiness of the feet, one should move the feet; for the sake of the bliss and emptiness of the hands, one should move the hands; one should worship with the bliss of the left side.

original: lus kyi bde ba stong pa nyid du bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: lus kyi bde ba stong pa nyid du bsgom pa ni /
translated: The meditation on the bliss of the body as emptiness

original: shin tu'am rnam par g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu'am rnam par g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: is called ‚Äúvery moving.‚Äù

original: bde stong gi ched du tshim zhing za /
analyzed: bde stong gi ched du tshim zhing za /
translated: For the sake of bliss and emptiness, one should eat and be satisfied.

original: bde ba stong pa nyid kyi brtul zhugs las ma nyams na brtul zhugs rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba stong pa nyid kyi brtul zhugs las ma nyams na brtul zhugs rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: If one does not fall from the conduct of the bliss of emptiness, the conduct is complete.

original: sgrub pa bo zag med kyi dam tshig la brtson pa dang / zag med kyi rigs la spyod pa dang / zag med kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i zas la spyod pa dang / rigs lnga'am rigs bzhi 'dus ma byas kyi rigs gcig tu bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: sgrub pa bo zag med kyi dam tshig la brtson pa dang / zag med kyi rigs la spyod pa dang / zag med kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i zas la spyod pa dang / rigs lnga'am rigs bzhi 'dus ma byas kyi rigs gcig tu bsgom pa ni /
translated: The practitioner who is diligent in the uncontaminated pledge, who practices the uncontaminated family, who enjoys the food of the uncontaminated five sense objects, and who meditates on the five families or the four families as one unfabricated family,

original: sa thob pa ste /
analyzed: sa thob pa ste /
translated: attains the stage.

original: de ltar grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la mchod na yul gyi bsod snyoms don yod pa za bar yin no //
analyzed: de ltar grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la mchod na yul gyi bsod snyoms don yod pa za bar yin no //
translated: Thus, if one makes offerings to the yogis who have accomplished this, one eats the meaningful alms of the field.

original: stong pa nyid thob pa'i spros bcas kyi spyod pa ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thob pa'i spros bcas kyi spyod pa ni /
translated: The elaborate conduct of attaining emptiness is as follows.

original: sha lngas dkyil 'khor gru gsum la mngon spyod byed pa phyi'i sbyin sreg go //
analyzed: sha lngas dkyil 'khor gru gsum la mngon spyod byed pa phyi'i sbyin sreg go //
translated: The outer burnt offering is the wrathful activity of the five meats in the triangular mandala.

original: de bzhin du dpa' bo'i zas phrin las rnam bzhi sngags dang phyag rgya dang ldan pas dpal he ru ka'i lus kyi dkyil 'khor sbrul la /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpa' bo'i zas phrin las rnam bzhi sngags dang phyag rgya dang ldan pas dpal he ru ka'i lus kyi dkyil 'khor sbrul la /
translated: Similarly, the inner burnt offering is the four activities of the hero's food, endowed with mantra and mudra, emanating the mandala of the body of glorious Heruka.

original: sbyin sreg gi bstan bcos rgya chen po pha rol gzhan las byung ba bzhin du nang gi sbyin sreg bya ba dang / gtum mo drod rtag tu bzung bar byas nas phrin las rnam bzhi kun la gtum mo drod kyi 'khor lo bzhi bsregs nas byang chub kyi sems phab pa bsrungs na bgegs mi 'byung bas gsang ba'i sbyin sreg 'di la dngos grub gzhan du 'gyur mi srid do //
analyzed: sbyin sreg gi bstan bcos rgya chen po pha rol gzhan las byung ba bzhin du nang gi sbyin sreg bya ba dang / gtum mo drod rtag tu bzung bar byas nas phrin las rnam bzhi kun la gtum mo drod kyi 'khor lo bzhi bsregs nas byang chub kyi sems phab pa bsrungs na bgegs mi 'byung bas gsang ba'i sbyin sreg 'di la dngos grub gzhan du 'gyur mi srid do //
translated: The secret burnt offering is the retention of the heat of fierce fire, always burning the wheel of heat of fierce fire in all four activities. If one protects the descent of bodhicitta, since there are no obstacles, it is impossible for any other power to arise in this secret burnt offering.

original: chags pa'i lam gyi sbyin sreg ni bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen lta bu'i pho nya mchog bzang po dang ting nge 'dzin brtson zhing lhan cig ldan pa pas byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu ngu bzhin du btsun mo'i bha ga thab khung gsang ba'i rdo rje dbang
analyzed: chags pa'i lam gyi sbyin sreg ni bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen lta bu'i pho nya mchog bzang po dang ting nge 'dzin brtson zhing lhan cig ldan pa pas byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu ngu bzhin du btsun mo'i bha ga thab khung gsang ba'i rdo rje dbang
translated: The fire offering of the path of passion is the secret vajra of the bhaga of the queen, the hearth, which is offered into the blazing fire of the hero‚Äôs bhaga, the supreme, excellent messenger, who is endowed with concentration and perseverance, like the bodhisattva Sadaprarudita.

original: gzar / byang chub sems kyi dbang blugs ma chags dga' ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pas dga' bral gyi rjes rnam par 'byed pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzar / byang chub sems kyi dbang blugs ma chags dga' ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pas dga' bral gyi rjes rnam par 'byed pa spong ba yin no //
translated: The offering of bodhicitta is the enjoyment of nonattachment, which is the separation of the subsequent joy.

original: bla ma'i man ngag gis de'i don stong pa nyid du bsgrubs nas bla na med pa'i sbyin sreg tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla ma'i man ngag gis de'i don stong pa nyid du bsgrubs nas bla na med pa'i sbyin sreg tu 'gyur ro //
translated: By establishing the meaning of that with the guru‚Äôs intimate instruction as emptiness, it becomes the unsurpassable fire offering.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi don gyi mchod pa dang bstod pa dang brtul zhugs rdzogs nas 'bras bu dbang bzhi bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi don gyi mchod pa dang bstod pa dang brtul zhugs rdzogs nas 'bras bu dbang bzhi bsgom pa ni /
translated: Having perfected the worship, praise, and conduct for the benefit of others, the result is the meditation on the four empowerments.

original: rdo rje spun @211b dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi spun dang / gtso bo bde mchog pha dang / yum dang lhan cig bde mchog nyid du lha'i mig gi mngon shes kyi mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: rdo rje spun @211b dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi spun dang / gtso bo bde mchog pha dang / yum dang lhan cig bde mchog nyid du lha'i mig gi mngon shes kyi mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: At that time, when the twenty-four vajra siblings, the heroes, and the principal couple, Cakrasa·πÉvara, see with the supernormal knowledge of the divine eye,

original: lce sbom zhes bya ba dung can ma'i mtshan nyid dang / mig dmar ser zhes bya ba padma can gyi mtshan nyid dang / rtsub bcing zhes bya ba ri dags can gyi mtshan nyid dang / spu ni dmar ser yin zhes bya ba phreng ba can gyi mtshan nyid mi slob pa'i stong pa nyid bskyed pa'i lha mo ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i le'u lnga bcu rtsa dgu pa las bshad pa'o /
analyzed: lce sbom zhes bya ba dung can ma'i mtshan nyid dang / mig dmar ser zhes bya ba padma can gyi mtshan nyid dang / rtsub bcing zhes bya ba ri dags can gyi mtshan nyid dang / spu ni dmar ser yin zhes bya ba phreng ba can gyi mtshan nyid mi slob pa'i stong pa nyid bskyed pa'i lha mo ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i le'u lnga bcu rtsa dgu pa las bshad pa'o /
translated: the one called ‚Äúthick tongue,‚Äù the characteristics of the conch-bearer, ‚Äúred-yellow eyes,‚Äù the characteristics of the lotus-bearer, ‚Äúrough binding,‚Äù the characteristics of the deer-bearer, and ‚Äúred-yellow hair,‚Äù the characteristics of the garland-bearer, are explained in the fifty-ninth chapter of the Vajra·∏çƒÅka.

original: // / de la rnal 'byor bzhi bskyed pa skye ba'i rim pa ni /
analyzed: // / de la rnal 'byor bzhi bskyed pa skye ba'i rim pa ni /
translated: The creation of the four yogas is the stage of creation.

original: dngos grub thams cad kyi rgyu aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa'i bzlas pa dang / bde stong gi brtul zhugs la dga' ba la dran pa'i nges pa drangs nas mngon sum gyi chad ma dang yang dag par ldan pas gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi'am mkha' 'gro ma spyod pa mngon shes dang /
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad kyi rgyu aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa'i bzlas pa dang / bde stong gi brtul zhugs la dga' ba la dran pa'i nges pa drangs nas mngon sum gyi chad ma dang yang dag par ldan pas gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi'am mkha' 'gro ma spyod pa mngon shes dang /
translated: The recitation of all the causes of spiritual powers entering the avadh≈´ti, and the recollection of the certainty of the practice of bliss and emptiness, are the direct perception of the twenty-four sacred sites or the conduct of the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s with clairvoyance.üîΩ

original: grol ba rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyi 'bras bu ster ba dung can ma yin no //
analyzed: grol ba rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyi 'bras bu ster ba dung can ma yin no //
translated: The conch-shell channel is not the bestower of the result of the direct perception of the yogi/nƒ´, the twenty-four places or the conduct of the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´, clairvoyance, and liberation, since it is the repetition of the cause of all powers, the life-force of the root mantra, which enters the avadh≈´ti, and the delight in the deliberate conduct of bliss and emptiness, which is induced by the ascertainment of mindfulness.

original: rjes su rnal 'byor 'dod pa'i don dngos grub kun bsgrubs na rtsa ba'i sngags srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa zlos shing snod bcud kyi 'jig rten gsum gyi 'bras bu yid nang du chud pa'i sngags 'di las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: rjes su rnal 'byor 'dod pa'i don dngos grub kun bsgrubs na rtsa ba'i sngags srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa zlos shing snod bcud kyi 'jig rten gsum gyi 'bras bu yid nang du chud pa'i sngags 'di las byung ba yin te /
translated: If one practices the subsequent yoga for the sake of all powers, one should repeat the root mantra, the life-force of which enters the avadh≈´ti, and one should think that the result of the three worlds of the environment and its inhabitants arises from this mantra.

original: de'i padma can dang snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i padma can dang snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: This is the union with the padminƒ´.

original: shin tu rnal 'byor ni sgrub pa po dngos grub la brtson ba rgyu'i rkyen dang / sngags yid nang du chud pa mtshungs pa med pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / phyag rgya dang ldan pa dmigs pa'i rkyen las gal te /
analyzed: shin tu rnal 'byor ni sgrub pa po dngos grub la brtson ba rgyu'i rkyen dang / sngags yid nang du chud pa mtshungs pa med pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / phyag rgya dang ldan pa dmigs pa'i rkyen las gal te /
translated: The unexcelled retention of the mantra in the mind is the immediately preceding condition.

original: tshogs pa ma tshad na yul dmigs pa'i rkyen phyag rgya ri dags can lta bu dang bral na /
analyzed: tshogs pa ma tshad na yul dmigs pa'i rkyen phyag rgya ri dags can lta bu dang bral na /
translated: The condition of the objective field is the possession of a seal.

original: yid nang du chud pa'i gsang sngags kyi lus can rnal 'byor pas la sems kyi stong nyid rtogs par byin gyis mi brlab po //
analyzed: yid nang du chud pa'i gsang sngags kyi lus can rnal 'byor pas la sems kyi stong nyid rtogs par byin gyis mi brlab po //
translated: If the assembly is incomplete, the yogi who has the body of the mantra with the unexcelled retention in the mind will not be empowered to realize the emptiness of the mind.

original: skye ba'i dus ji srid dro ba'i bya ba dag ces bya ba gtum mo drod kyi byang chub kyi sems phab pas dbang po bdag po'i rkyen dang bzhi tshogs na shin tu rnal 'byor rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i dus ji srid dro ba'i bya ba dag ces bya ba gtum mo drod kyi byang chub kyi sems phab pas dbang po bdag po'i rkyen dang bzhi tshogs na shin tu rnal 'byor rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the time of birth is as long as the function of heat, the bodhicitta of the heat of fierce fire descends, and if the four assemblies are complete, the very yoga will be realized.

original: rnal 'byor 'dod pa'i don zung 'ug gi rnal 'byor chen po ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'dod pa'i don zung 'ug gi rnal 'byor chen po ni /
translated: The great yoga of the pair, the object of desire, is as follows.

original: blo gros chen po mthong rnams kyis //

translated: Having placed the five am·πõtas on the tongue, one should confer the secret empowerment.

analyzed: de nas nyin zhag gsum pa la slob ma'i gdong phye la lus kyi dkyil 'khor bstan nas /
translated: Then, on the third day, after the disciple‚Äôs eyes are uncovered and the ma·πá·∏çala of the body is shown,

analyzed: bde ba stong pa nyid bskyed pa'i lha'i gnas rtsa dbu ma gang yin pa der 'dus ma byas kyi stong nyid de yang bstan par bya'o //
translated: That is, the place of the deity, the central channel, which generates the bliss of emptiness, should be shown to be the emptiness of the unconditioned.

analyzed: de ltar bla ma nyes pa dang / dbang bskur ba nges par byas nas de'i rjes la sgrub pa pos yon dbul ba rab tu nges par bya'o //
translated: Having thus ascertained the faults of the master and the conferral of empowerment, the practitioner should definitely offer a gift.

original: de ltar byas pa'i phan yon ni //

original: sngags pa dkyil 'khor ma mthong bas dngos grub mi 'thob pa dang / sku gsum gyi dkyil 'khor 'dir dbang bskur na lha la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa dang / de nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa las khyad par du 'gyur ba ston to //

original: de ltar phan yon lnga bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar phan yon lnga bshad nas /

analyzed: de nas gzhan yang @216b bshad bya ba //üîΩzhes gsungs te /

original: dbang bskur ba ni mchod pa dang bstod nas dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni mchod pa dang bstod nas dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúempowerment‚Äù is the empowerment conferred after the offerings and praises.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni bsgom bzlas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni bsgom bzlas so //
translated: The ‚Äúmeditative concentration‚Äù is the meditation and recitation.

original: mchod pa ni bdud rtsi myang ba dang rkang pa brgyad pa dang gtor ma gtong ba'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni bdud rtsi myang ba dang rkang pa brgyad pa dang gtor ma gtong ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúoffering‚Äù is the tasting of elixir, the eight lines, and the torma offering.

original: nye bar bsdu ba ni dkyil 'khor lus la gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba ni dkyil 'khor lus la gzhug pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúconclusion‚Äù is the dissolution of the ma·πá·∏çala into one‚Äôs body.

original: spyir de ltar yin pa las skabs 'dir cho ga'i ming ni gzhan dag thabs shes rab kyi spro bsdu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spyir de ltar yin pa las skabs 'dir cho ga'i ming ni gzhan dag thabs shes rab kyi spro bsdu zhes bya ste /
translated: In general, that being so, in this context, the name of the rite is ‚Äúthe emanation and gathering of method and wisdom.‚Äù

original: dbyangs yig bcu drug ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: dbyangs yig bcu drug ni shes rab bo //
translated: The sixteen vowels are wisdom.

original: gsal byed sum cu rtsa bzhi ni thabs so //
analyzed: gsal byed sum cu rtsa bzhi ni thabs so //
translated: The thirty-four consonants are method.

original: de gnyis nyi zla kha sbyor gyi lha mo las lha thams cad bskyed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis nyi zla kha sbyor gyi lha mo las lha thams cad bskyed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those two are the generation of all the deities from the goddess of the union of the sun and moon.

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob ston pa'i chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong yang yi ge phyi mo rnams las skyes /
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob ston pa'i chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong yang yi ge phyi mo rnams las skyes /
translated: The eighty-four thousand doors of Dharma that teach the ultimate and the conventional also arise from the phonemes.

original: sngags kyi spyod pa phrin las rnam bzhi thams cad kyi rgyud shes rab dang thabs a'a li k'a li las 'gro zhing skye'o //üîΩthog @223a * //üîΩma'i dbyangs dang gsal byed ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dge ba'i lha'am /
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa phrin las rnam bzhi thams cad kyi rgyud shes rab dang thabs a'a li k'a li las 'gro zhing skye'o // thog @223a * // ma'i dbyangs dang gsal byed ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dge ba'i lha'am /
translated: All the tantras of the four activities of mantra conduct arise from and are produced by the vowels and consonants of wisdom and method.üîΩThe first vowels and consonants are the ornaments or belts of the body mandalas of the virtuous deities of pacification and increase,

original: dbang dang mngon spyod mi dge ba'i lha'i lus kyi dkyil 'khor rgyan nam ska rags lta bu a'a li k'a li las byung ngo //
analyzed: dbang dang mngon spyod mi dge ba'i lha'i lus kyi dkyil 'khor rgyan nam ska rags lta bu a'a li k'a li las byung ngo //
translated: or the nonvirtuous deities of power and destruction, which arise from the vowels and consonants.

original: de ltar las dang po pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa rdzus skyes kyi sgrub pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: de ltar las dang po pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa rdzus skyes kyi sgrub pa'i thabs so //
translated: Thus, this is the method of creation for beginners, the method of creation for the miraculously born.

original: rdzogs rim gyi dbang du byas nas a'a li k'a li khrag dang byang chub sems kyi thig le la sogs te lte ba'i khrag gi thig le gtsub gtan /
analyzed: rdzogs rim gyi dbang du byas nas a'a li k'a li khrag dang byang chub sems kyi thig le la sogs te lte ba'i khrag gi thig le gtsub gtan /
translated: From the perspective of the completion stage, the vowels and consonants are the drops of blood and bodhicitta, and so on. The drop of blood at the navel is the kindling.

original: dbus ma rtsa aa wa dh'u t'i srub shing /
analyzed: dbus ma rtsa aa wa dh'u t'i srub shing /
translated: The central channel avadh≈´tƒ´ is the churning stick.

original: g-yas g-yon gyi rlung srub thag / bsrubs pa las khrag gi thig le las byung nas snying ga'i a'a li k'a li byang chub kyi sems bzhus pas gzhon nu ma'i bde ba lta bu ngal so //
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi rlung srub thag / bsrubs pa las khrag gi thig le las byung nas snying ga'i a'a li k'a li byang chub kyi sems bzhus pas gzhon nu ma'i bde ba lta bu ngal so //
translated: The winds on the right and left are the churning sticks, and from the churning of those arises a drop of blood. That melts the bodhicitta of the ƒÅlikƒÅli at the heart, and one rests in the bliss like that of a young maiden.

original: bde ba skyes pa la sems kyi chos nyid bsam gnyis mi khyab pa 'dus ma byas kyi sems myong bar mi rtag / sems de nyid don dam par bsams na 'dzin pa rdo rje 'chang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba skyes pa la sems kyi chos nyid bsam gnyis mi khyab pa 'dus ma byas kyi sems myong bar mi rtag / sems de nyid don dam par bsams na 'dzin pa rdo rje 'chang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of mind, the inconceivable, unconditioned mind, is not experienced in the arising of bliss. If one reflects on that mind itself as ultimate, one will attain the state of Vajradhara.

original: 'di ni nang gi a'a li k'a li don rang gi mtshan nyid de rgyud sde bzhi gsang ba lag na rdo rje khyod la bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nang gi a'a li k'a li don rang gi mtshan nyid de rgyud sde bzhi gsang ba lag na rdo rje khyod la bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the inner ƒÅlikƒÅli, the nature of its own characteristics, which I, VajrapƒÅ·πái, have explained to you.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs lha'i 'khor lo dang / ye shes kyi tshogs 'dus ma byas rtogs pa gnyis ka'i rgyud bum pa so btang ba lta bu mi 'jigs pa thig le bsgom pa 'di 'bar bas spar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs lha'i 'khor lo dang / ye shes kyi tshogs 'dus ma byas rtogs pa gnyis ka'i rgyud bum pa so btang ba lta bu mi 'jigs pa thig le bsgom pa 'di 'bar bas spar bar bya'o //
translated: The two accumulations‚Äîthe accumulation of merit, the divine wheel, and the accumulation of wisdom, the realization of the unconditioned‚Äîare like a vase that has been fired. One should ignite the blazing bindu of fearlessness.

original: bskyed rim gyi dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyang 'dis 'thob /
analyzed: bskyed rim gyi dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyang 'dis 'thob /
translated: All the heroes and yoginis of the creation stage are also attained by this.

original: nges brjod bla ma'i rgyud kyi mngon sum gyi man ngag 'di snod min la mi bshad /
analyzed: nges brjod bla ma'i rgyud kyi mngon sum gyi man ngag 'di snod min la mi bshad /
translated: This esoteric instruction of the direct realization of the exalted mantra is not to be explained to those who are not suitable vessels.

original: bshad na tshe 'dir sdug bsngal /
analyzed: bshad na tshe 'dir sdug bsngal /
translated: If it is explained, there will be suffering in this life.

original: tshe phyi mar mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: tshe phyi mar mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu mi 'thob bo //
translated: In the next life, the result of nirvana will not be attained.üîΩThe analogy of the wet vase is that even if one meditates for a long while on the wheel of the deities of the creation stage, it will be destroyed by the appearances of conceptuality.

original: bum pa rlon pa lta bu ni bskyed rim lha'i 'khor lo yun ring por bsgoms kyang rnam rtog gi snang bas 'jig pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dbu ma lta bu rjes dpag gi stong pa nyid bsgom pa yang bskal pa grangs med gcig gis sa dang po thob pas rnam rtog yun ring bas rdzogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bum pa rlon pa lta bu ni bskyed rim lha'i 'khor lo yun ring por bsgoms kyang rnam rtog gi snang bas 'jig pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dbu ma lta bu rjes dpag gi stong pa nyid bsgom pa yang bskal pa grangs med gcig gis sa dang po thob pas rnam rtog yun ring bas rdzogs par 'gyur la /
translated: The analogy of the wisdom accumulation, the central channel, is that even if one meditates on the emptiness of inference, the first stage will be attained after one incalculable eon.

original: srog aa wa dh'u t'i ra chud nas bde ba stong nyid bsgom pa ni 'dus ma byas mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i lam bum pa so btang ba lta bu phyir mi ldog pa'i lam mi 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: srog aa wa dh'u t'i ra chud nas bde ba stong nyid bsgom pa ni 'dus ma byas mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i lam bum pa so btang ba lta bu phyir mi ldog pa'i lam mi 'jig pa yin no //
translated: The analogy of the vase that has been fired is that once the bindu of bodhicitta is brought into the central channel, the meditation on bliss and emptiness is the direct perception of the unconditioned.

original: dper na bud med dang byis pa tshogs nas phan tshun kun du smra /
analyzed: dper na bud med dang byis pa tshogs nas phan tshun kun du smra /
translated: For example, when women and children gather together, they talk to each other.üîΩEven though they rely on each other with approval, it is meaningless.

original: rjes su yi rang pas bsten yang don med pa de bzhin du bskyed rim dang rjes dpag gis lam dge ba zag bcas @223b zag med ma bshad pas 'ching bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang pas bsten yang don med pa de bzhin du bskyed rim dang rjes dpag gis lam dge ba zag bcas @223b zag med ma bshad pas 'ching bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, the path of the contaminated and uncontaminated virtue of the creation stage and inference is not explained, so it is a bondage.

original: mi'i lus po 'jim ba lta bu bskyed rim gyis bum ba lta bur bcos /
analyzed: mi'i lus po 'jim ba lta bu bskyed rim gyis bum ba lta bur bcos /
translated: The human body, like clay, is formed by the creation stage like a vase.

original: rjes dpag gis don dam pa'i lhar bcos kyang rung /
analyzed: rjes dpag gis don dam pa'i lhar bcos kyang rung /
translated: It is also all right to form it as the ultimate deity with inference.

original: dge ba zag bcas bum pa rlon pa dang 'dra /
analyzed: dge ba zag bcas bum pa rlon pa dang 'dra /
translated: Contaminated virtue is like a wet vase.üîΩWhen the life-force enters the avadh≈´ti, bliss and emptiness are directly accomplished.

original: srog aa wa dh'u t'i ra chud nas bde ba stong pa mngon sum gyis grub pa'i tshe rnal 'byor lus brtan pa gzugs dang / g-yo ba tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed rnam par shes pa kun dpal he ru ka'i sku'i yan lag bcu gnas bcur mkha' 'gro ma'i brda ming btags pa /
analyzed: srog aa wa dh'u t'i ra chud nas bde ba stong pa mngon sum gyis grub pa'i tshe rnal 'byor lus brtan pa gzugs dang / g-yo ba tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed rnam par shes pa kun dpal he ru ka'i sku'i yan lag bcu gnas bcur mkha' 'gro ma'i brda ming btags pa /
translated: At that time, the body of the yogin is stable. Form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are all the ten limbs of the body of ≈örƒ´ Heruka. The ten places are named with the symbolic names of the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s.

original: mtho ris thugs dang sa steng gsung dang sa 'og sku'i dpa' bo'i yan lag brtan g-yo thams cad he ru ka'i phyag dang zhabs dang mig spyan du 'gyur /
analyzed: mtho ris thugs dang sa steng gsung dang sa 'og sku'i dpa' bo'i yan lag brtan g-yo thams cad he ru ka'i phyag dang zhabs dang mig spyan du 'gyur /
translated: The upper realms are the hero's mind, the earth is his speech, and the underworld is his body, and all of the animate and inanimate universe is Heruka's hands, feet, and eyes.

original: mgo bo dbur 'gyur /üîΩbyang zhal du 'gyur /
analyzed: mgo bo dbur 'gyur / byang zhal du 'gyur /
translated: The head is the crown protrusion.üîΩThe northern face is the ear.

original: rna ba snyan du 'gyur /
analyzed: rna ba snyan du 'gyur /
translated: The world is the nose.

original: 'jig rten na yod pa thams cad g-yogs pa bzhin du mngon sum du grub nas brjod byar bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yod pa thams cad g-yogs pa bzhin du mngon sum du grub nas brjod byar bzhugs so //
translated: All that exists in the world is manifest as the hero's body, and is present as the subject matter.

original: a'a li k'a li bum pa so btang ba lta bu'i thig le'i 'khor lo bde mchog bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li bum pa so btang ba lta bu'i thig le'i 'khor lo bde mchog bstan pa yin no //
translated: The wheel of the bindu, like a vase with its mouth removed, is taught to be supreme bliss.

original: da ni mngal skyes kyi 'bras bu dang bcas pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: da ni mngal skyes kyi 'bras bu dang bcas pa bshad pa ni /
translated: Now, the womb birth with its result is explained.üîΩThen, the adept should practice

original: de nas dngos grub bsgrub bya ba //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas dngos grub bsgrub bya ba // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the powers.

original: mngal skyes kyi bsam gtan gyi sems don bcu bzhis sa bcas pa sgrub pa po la phan pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: mngal skyes kyi bsam gtan gyi sems don bcu bzhis sa bcas pa sgrub pa po la phan pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: The womb birth is taught for the sake of the adept, with the fourteen topics of the mind of concentration, and the practice of the stages.

original: de nas gzhan yang mdo sde dang rgyud dag tu sbas pa'i dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i brda ni dang po'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang mdo sde dang rgyud dag tu sbas pa'i dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i brda ni dang po'o //
translated: Next, the first is the secret language of the heroes and yoginƒ´s hidden in the s≈´tras and tantras.

original: gos stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang phyag mtshan lnga cod pan dang rgyan la sogs pa ni lus kyi kun du spyod pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gos stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang phyag mtshan lnga cod pan dang rgyan la sogs pa ni lus kyi kun du spyod pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the bodily conduct, such as the upper and lower garments, the five symbolic ornaments, the crown, and ornaments.

original: shes rab mdun du gzhag pa ni gsum mo //
analyzed: shes rab mdun du gzhag pa ni gsum mo //
translated: The third is the placement of the wisdom consort in front.

original: phur bu dang dra ba la sogs pa ni srung ba'i 'khor bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: phur bu dang dra ba la sogs pa ni srung ba'i 'khor bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the protection wheel, such as the dagger and the net.

original: a'a li k'a li brjod pa bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li brjod pa bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs pa lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the accumulation of merit, such as reciting the ƒÅlikƒÅli.

original: rnam thar sgo gsum gyi rgyud la sogs pa stong pa ye shes kyi tshogs ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam thar sgo gsum gyi rgyud la sogs pa stong pa ye shes kyi tshogs ni drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the accumulation of wisdom, such as the emptiness of the three doors of liberation.

original: nyi zla kha sbyor du sems 'jug pa'i yig 'bru dang phyag mtshan la sogs pas lhar bskyed pa ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: nyi zla kha sbyor du sems 'jug pa'i yig 'bru dang phyag mtshan la sogs pas lhar bskyed pa ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the generation of the deity by the syllables and symbolic implements of the mind entering into the union of the sun and moon.

original: rgyu'i he ru ka gsungs pa ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i he ru ka gsungs pa ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the recitation of the causal Heruka.

original: glu'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: glu'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni dgu pa'o //
translated: The ninth is the union with the song.

original: bdud rtsi tshim byed myang ba dang ye shes sems dpa' bcu pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi tshim byed myang ba dang ye shes sems dpa' bcu pa'o //
translated: The tenth is the enjoyment of the nectar and the wisdom being.

original: lag pa'i mchod pas go cha bskon pa ni bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa'i mchod pas go cha bskon pa ni bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: The eleventh is the armoring with the hand worship.

original: dbang bskur ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o //üîΩgo cha chen po lus kyi dkyil 'khor dang sems kyi dkyil @224a * //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o // go cha chen po lus kyi dkyil 'khor dang sems kyi dkyil @224a * //
translated: The twelfth is the consecration.

original: 'khor bsgom pa ni bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor bsgom pa ni bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: The thirteenth is the meditation on the great armor, the body mandala and the mind mandala.

original: sngags kyi mchod bstod gtor ma gtang ba ni bcu bzhi pa'o //üîΩmi mchog gang zhig kun spyod pa //
analyzed: sngags kyi mchod bstod gtor ma gtang ba ni bcu bzhi pa'o // mi mchog gang zhig kun spyod pa //
translated: The fourteenth is the mantra worship, praise, and sending of the sacrificial cake.

original: zhes bya ba tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis ni smon lam dang yon no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis ni smon lam dang yon no //
translated: The two and a half verses beginning with ‚ÄúThe one who practices this supreme human‚Äù are the aspiration and the fee.

original: 'bras bu ni zla ba nyal mtshan ma thob nas dngos grub blangs nas zag med kyi ye shes dang ldan pas mtho ris kyi longs spyod lha'i 'khor los sgyur ba dngos grub 'bring /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni zla ba nyal mtshan ma thob nas dngos grub blangs nas zag med kyi ye shes dang ldan pas mtho ris kyi longs spyod lha'i 'khor los sgyur ba dngos grub 'bring /
translated: The result is that, having attained the signs of the sleeping moon, having taken up the powers, and being endowed with uncontaminated wisdom, the power of a celestial universal monarch is the middling power.

original: mi'i 'khor los sgyur ba dngos grub tha ma /
analyzed: mi'i 'khor los sgyur ba dngos grub tha ma /
translated: The power of a human universal monarch is the least power.

original: rnal 'byor pa 'pho ba'i tshe mkha' spyod kyi gnas bde ba can nam /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa 'pho ba'i tshe mkha' spyod kyi gnas bde ba can nam /
translated: When the yogi dies, the place of the celestial realm is the Blissful Land.

original: mngon bar dga' bar khrid nas skyes pa ni dngos grub rab bo //
analyzed: mngon bar dga' bar khrid nas skyes pa ni dngos grub rab bo //
translated: Leading to manifest joy is the highest power.

original: le'u lnga bcu rtsa drug gi 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu rtsa drug gi 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the fifty-sixth chapter.üîΩChapter Fifty-Seven:

original: // / dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi sngags btu ba /
analyzed: // / dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi sngags btu ba /
translated: The Compendium of All Mandalas

original: de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba //
translated: Now, next, I will explainüîΩThe method of extracting the mantras of all mandalas.

original: zhes bya ba smos te rgyud 'dir btu ba'i thabs kyang bzhi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te rgyud 'dir btu ba'i thabs kyang bzhi /
translated: In this tantra, the method of extraction is fourfold,

original: 'bras bu bcu gcig yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu bcu gcig yin no //
translated: and the result is elevenfold.

original: de la rtsa ba'i rgyud las ae gru gsum gyi dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad la sde tshan brgyad bkod pa ni btu ba'i gnas dang po'o //
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i rgyud las ae gru gsum gyi dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad la sde tshan brgyad bkod pa ni btu ba'i gnas dang po'o //
translated: In the Root Tantra, in the center of the triangle of E, with the eight sections on the eight-petaled lotus, is the first place of extraction.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro las gzhal yas khang gi dbus su re'u mig bzhi bcu rtsa dgu gris pa ni btu ba'i gnas gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro las gzhal yas khang gi dbus su re'u mig bzhi bcu rtsa dgu gris pa ni btu ba'i gnas gnyis pa'o //
translated: In the Vajradaka, in the center of the celestial mansion, with the forty-nine squares divided, is the second place of extraction.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud le'u sum cu rtsa gcig pa nas rdza rnga'i dbyibs kyi nang du re'u mig bzhi bcu rtsa dgu byas nas btu ba'i gnas gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud le'u sum cu rtsa gcig pa nas rdza rnga'i dbyibs kyi nang du re'u mig bzhi bcu rtsa dgu byas nas btu ba'i gnas gsum pa'o //
translated: In the thirty-first chapter of the Root Tantra, with the forty-nine squares made in the shape of a clay drum, is the third place of extraction.

original: mnyam sbyor gyi rgyud phyi ma las padma 'dab ma brgyad dang mtshams bzhi dang bcas pa las byung ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam sbyor gyi rgyud phyi ma las padma 'dab ma brgyad dang mtshams bzhi dang bcas pa las byung ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The Continuation of the Tantra of Union states that the fourth is the one that arises from the eight lotus petals and the four intermediate directions.

original: btu ba'i thabs ni bzhi ste dbyangs dang gsal byed kyis btu ba dang / ming gis btu ba dang / lha'i 'khrul 'khor gyis btu ba dang / phyed btus pa ste bzhi'o //
analyzed: btu ba'i thabs ni bzhi ste dbyangs dang gsal byed kyis btu ba dang / ming gis btu ba dang / lha'i 'khrul 'khor gyis btu ba dang / phyed btus pa ste bzhi'o //
translated: The methods of extracting the mantras are four: extracting by means of vowels and consonants, extracting by means of names, extracting by means of the divine machine, and extracting by means of the half.

original: 'bras bu ni bcu gcig ste yab yum gyi snying po bzhi dang / dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i sngags gnyis dang go cha gnyis dang rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags gnyis dang / gnod mdzes kyi sngags dang bcu gcig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni bcu gcig ste yab yum gyi snying po bzhi dang / dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i sngags gnyis dang go cha gnyis dang rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags gnyis dang / gnod mdzes kyi sngags dang bcu gcig go //
translated: The results are eleven: the four essences of the male and female deities, the two mantras of the hero and heroine, the two armors, the two mantras of the eight lines, and the mantra of Sumbha.

original: 'dir sngags btu ba ni dben pa'i gnas su bdud rtsi lngas byugs la /
analyzed: 'dir sngags btu ba ni dben pa'i gnas su bdud rtsi lngas byugs la /
translated: Here, the extraction of the mantras is performed in an isolated place, anointed with the five nectars.

original: ae gru gsum gyi dbus su /

original: de'i phan yon ni rig pa rgyal ba'i gsang sngags te bya ba dngos grub thams cad sgrub pa zag bcas kyi 'jig rten gsum na dpal he ru ka zag med kyi sngags shes na mchog yin no //

original: rdza rda kha bzhi pa bri ste /
analyzed: rdza rda kha bzhi pa bri ste /

original: re'u mig bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa la yi ge'i phyi mo bkod pa gnas de las dpa' bo sumbha ni btu'o //
analyzed: re'u mig bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa la yi ge'i phyi mo bkod pa gnas de las dpa' bo sumbha ni btu'o //

analyzed: rim gyis btu ba'am rim las bzlog nas btu ba ni go sla'o //
translated: The extraction is either gradual or reverse.

original: de nyid bsdus pa dang / dpal mchog dang / bde mchog mnyam sbyor dang / rdo rje 'jigs byed la sogs par shar sngo ba /
analyzed: de nyid bsdus pa dang / dpal mchog dang / bde mchog mnyam sbyor dang / rdo rje 'jigs byed la sogs par shar sngo ba /
translated: In the Compendium of Reality, the Shriparamadya, the Samayoga of Shri Heruka, the Vajrabhairava, and so forth, the four surrounding circles are blue in the east,

analyzed: lho ser ba /

original: nub dmar ba /
analyzed: nub dmar ba /

translated: and green in the north, together with the eight wrathful half-body figures in the intermediate directions, for the purpose of protecting the mandala. One should meditate on the ten wrathful ones who subdue all the evil ones above and below,

original: yang na khro bo bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na khro bo bzhi bsgom par bya'o //

original: sha chen la sogs pa bdud rtsi lnga'i ri lus le'u bzhi pa las bshad pa bzhin du nang gi sbyin sreg byas nas rdo rje can brgya byin yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sha chen la sogs pa bdud rtsi lnga'i ri lus le'u bzhi pa las bshad pa bzhin du nang gi sbyin sreg byas nas rdo rje can brgya byin yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having performed the inner burnt offering with the five nectars such as human flesh and so forth, as explained in the fourth chapter, even Indra, the wielder of the vajra, will die.

original: sngags ni go sla'o //
analyzed: sngags ni go sla'o //
translated: The mantra is easy to understand.

original: dkyil 'khor ni nam mkha'i khams su padma 'dab @225b brgyad kyi lte ba'i dbus su yi ge h'um las h'um mdzad zhal brgyad phyag bcu drug par bsgom pa ni rgyud na gsal lo /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni nam mkha'i khams su padma 'dab @225b brgyad kyi lte ba'i dbus su yi ge h'um las h'um mdzad zhal brgyad phyag bcu drug par bsgom pa ni rgyud na gsal lo /
translated: The mandala is the space element, in the center of the hub of an eight-petaled lotus, meditating on Humkara from the syllable hum, with eight faces and sixteen arms, as it is clear in the tantra.

original: khro bo bzhi ni shar du 'dod pa'i rdo rje sngo ba /
analyzed: khro bo bzhi ni shar du 'dod pa'i rdo rje sngo ba /
translated: The four wrathful ones are blue Desire Vajra in the east,

original: byang du rdo rje rnon po ljang ba /
analyzed: byang du rdo rje rnon po ljang ba /
translated: green Sharp Vajra in the north,

original: nub tu stobs rdo rje dmar ba /
analyzed: nub tu stobs rdo rje dmar ba /
translated: red Power Vajra in the west,

original: lho ru mi g-yo rdo rje ser nag bdud bzhi gnon pa /
analyzed: lho ru mi g-yo rdo rje ser nag bdud bzhi gnon pa /
translated: and dark-red Immovable Vajra in the south, trampling the four mƒÅras.

original: shar 'khor lo dang dril bu /üîΩlhor rin po che dang dril bu /
analyzed: shar 'khor lo dang dril bu / lhor rin po che dang dril bu /
translated: In the east, a wheel and a bell;üîΩin the south, a jewel and a bell;

original: nub tu padma dang dril bu /
analyzed: nub tu padma dang dril bu /
translated: in the west, a lotus and a bell;

original: byang du rgya gram dang dril bu /
analyzed: byang du rgya gram dang dril bu /
translated: and in the north, a crossed vajra and a bell.

original: rang gi mtshan ma dril bur bcas //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan ma dril bur bcas //
translated: One‚Äôs own sign is with a bell.

original: zhes pa thams cad kyang khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya bcings pa zhal gsum phyag drug pa bsgoms la ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang go cha bskon pa dang dbang bskur ba dang / dpral ba lkog ma snying gar sku gsung thugs kyi sbyor ba bsgom /
analyzed: zhes pa thams cad kyang khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya bcings pa zhal gsum phyag drug pa bsgoms la ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang go cha bskon pa dang dbang bskur ba dang / dpral ba lkog ma snying gar sku gsung thugs kyi sbyor ba bsgom /
translated: Having visualized all of them as having three faces and six arms in the mudra of total victory over the three realms, one should meditate on the entry of the gnosis being, the donning of the armor, the conferral of empowerment, and the union of body, speech, and mind at the forehead, throat, and heart.

original: sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rnam dag yang bsgom /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rnam dag yang bsgom /
translated: One should also meditate on the purity of the thirty-seven.

original: sumbha na'i sngags bzlas /
analyzed: sumbha na'i sngags bzlas /
translated: One should recite the sumbha ni mantra.

original: ma grub na bskyar ba'i cho ga nang gi sbyin sreg khyi'i gzugs kyi linggas zhes sngags bza' ba dang / phag gi linggas gti mug bza' ba dang / khyim bya'i linggas 'dod chags bza' ba dang / mkha' 'gro la yang gtor ma bya ba dang /
analyzed: ma grub na bskyar ba'i cho ga nang gi sbyin sreg khyi'i gzugs kyi linggas zhes sngags bza' ba dang / phag gi linggas gti mug bza' ba dang / khyim bya'i linggas 'dod chags bza' ba dang / mkha' 'gro la yang gtor ma bya ba dang /
translated: If there is no accomplishment, one should repeat the rite of inner fire offering, the mantra to be eaten of the form of the dog, the mantra to be eaten of the pig, the mantra to be eaten of the lustful partridge, and the bali offering to the dakinis.

original: dung dang nya phyis dang mu tig rnams srog chags kyi rgyu las byung ba khyad par med kyang mi'i thod pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rgyud las byung bas /
analyzed: dung dang nya phyis dang mu tig rnams srog chags kyi rgyu las byung ba khyad par med kyang mi'i thod pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rgyud las byung bas /
translated: Conches, oysters, and pearls are not distinguished as being causes of living beings.

original: dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyan byas pa la smad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyan byas pa la smad par mi bya'o //
translated: But since the human skull is produced from the continuum of the accumulation of merit and knowledge, it should not be despised when used as an ornament by heroes and yoginis.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the ritual of turning the wheel of the ganacakra.

original: le'u drug cu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u drug cu pa'i 'grel pa'o /

original: // / dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi 'gro ba 'dul ba grong khyer dgug pa'i sngags kyi dkyil 'khor bshad pa ni /
analyzed: // / dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi 'gro ba 'dul ba grong khyer dgug pa'i sngags kyi dkyil 'khor bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the mandala of the mantra for subduing beings and summoning the city of all mandalas:

original: de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba smos te slob dpon a'arya de bas shar phyogs dri za'i yul du phyin nas 'gro ba mi dad pa las sde tshan brgyad kyi yi ge'i lha bkod nas sngags drag po bzlas pas rgyal po dang bcas pa g-yo ba dang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba smos te slob dpon a'arya de bas shar phyogs dri za'i yul du phyin nas 'gro ba mi dad pa las sde tshan brgyad kyi yi ge'i lha bkod nas sngags drag po bzlas pas rgyal po dang bcas pa g-yo ba dang /
translated: Then, it is said, I will explain another. Master ƒÄryadeva went to the gandharva land in the east and, having arranged the deities of the eight classes of letters from the faithless beings, by reciting the fierce mantra, the king and his retinue were shaken.

original: sems dga' bas btul ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sems dga' bas btul ba bzhin du /

analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi blo can @229a * //
translated: The person who meditates is a person who has the mind of emptiness,

original: 'jigs pa spangs pa rnam par rtog pa bcom pa tshad med pa dang ldan pa 'du 'dzi spangs pa'i rten gyi gang zag gis bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'jigs pa spangs pa rnam par rtog pa bcom pa tshad med pa dang ldan pa 'du 'dzi spangs pa'i rten gyi gang zag gis bsgom mo //
translated: who has abandoned fear, who has conquered conceptuality, who possesses the immeasurables, and who has abandoned distractions.

original: gnas gang du bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gang du bsgom zhe na /
translated: Where is the place of meditation?

original: shin tu bgrod dka'i dur khrod ces pa go sla'o //
analyzed: shin tu bgrod dka'i dur khrod ces pa go sla'o //
translated: The place of meditation is called ‚Äúthe charnel ground that is difficult to traverse.‚Äù

original: yang na zhal bzhi phyag brgyad pa'i zhal dbus ma sngo ba /
analyzed: yang na zhal bzhi phyag brgyad pa'i zhal dbus ma sngo ba /
translated: Alternatively, the central face is blue,

original: g-yas dkar ba g-yon dmar ba /
analyzed: g-yas dkar ba g-yon dmar ba /
translated: the right face is white, the left face is red,

original: steng ser ba /üîΩphyag dang po rdo rje dang dril bu /
analyzed: steng ser ba / phyag dang po rdo rje dang dril bu /
translated: and the face above is yellow.üîΩThe first pair of hands hold a vajra and a bell,

original: rdo rje dang thod pa mdung dang cang te'u /
analyzed: rdo rje dang thod pa mdung dang cang te'u /
translated: a vajra and skull cup, a spear and a small drum,üîΩand a sword and a kha·π≠vƒÅ·πÖga.

original: mgo bo dang gri gug thogs pa'o /
analyzed: mgo bo dang gri gug thogs pa'o /
translated: He has a head and a flaying knife.

original: yang na ma he'i gdong can zhal dgu phyag sum cu rtsa bzhi pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: yang na ma he'i gdong can zhal dgu phyag sum cu rtsa bzhi pa bsgom mo //
translated: Alternatively, one should meditate on the nine-faced, thirty-four-armed form of the deity, with the face of a water buffalo.

original: ma he'i gdong can ni phyag sum cu rtsa bzhis sna tshogs pa'i mtshon cha bsnams pa ma he'i zhal gyi ljags bskyod pa /
analyzed: ma he'i gdong can ni phyag sum cu rtsa bzhis sna tshogs pa'i mtshon cha bsnams pa ma he'i zhal gyi ljags bskyod pa /
translated: The one with the face of a water buffalo has thirty-four arms holding various weapons, and the tongue of the water buffalo face is moving.üîΩThe other eight faces utter the eight sounds of ha ha, hi hi, h≈´·πÉ h≈´·πÉ, pha·π≠ pha·π≠, and the single hero radiates light rays and is terrifying.üîΩThe eight directions and the eight female sky-farers are all difficult to tame, but he tames them.üîΩThe wisdom-being is inserted, the armor is donned, and the empowerment is conferred.

original: zhal lhag ma brgyad kyis ha ha hi hi h'um h'um phat phat brgyad sgrogs pa dang / dpa' bo gcig pu 'od zer 'phros pas 'jigs par mdzad pa phyogs skyong ba brgyad dang chung ma mkha' 'gro ma brgyad gdul dka' thams cad 'dul bar mdzad pa ye shes sems dpa' bcug go cha bskon dbang bskur sgom pa'i tshe sku gsung thugs kyi khro bo spro
analyzed: zhal lhag ma brgyad kyis ha ha hi hi h'um h'um phat phat brgyad sgrogs pa dang / dpa' bo gcig pu 'od zer 'phros pas 'jigs par mdzad pa phyogs skyong ba brgyad dang chung ma mkha' 'gro ma brgyad gdul dka' thams cad 'dul bar mdzad pa ye shes sems dpa' bcug go cha bskon dbang bskur sgom pa'i tshe sku gsung thugs kyi khro bo spro
translated: When meditating, one emanates the wrathful deities of body, speech, and mind.

original: dam tshig gi spro bsdu byas nas bzlas /
analyzed: dam tshig gi spro bsdu byas nas bzlas /
translated: One should recite after performing the emanation and re-absorption of the pledge beings.

original: phan yon ni khams gsum gyi sdig pa za ba dang / mtshams med pa lnga byed pa za ba dang / sdug bsngal srid pa spyod /
analyzed: phan yon ni khams gsum gyi sdig pa za ba dang / mtshams med pa lnga byed pa za ba dang / sdug bsngal srid pa spyod /
translated: The benefit is that it consumes the nonvirtue of the three realms, it consumes the five acts with immediate result, and it consumes the conduct of suffering existence.

original: bklags pas 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: bklags pas 'grub pa yin no //
translated: It is accomplished by recitation.

original: las la sbyor ba'i tshe na gdug pa can dang gnod pa can gyi ling+ga byas la /
analyzed: las la sbyor ba'i tshe na gdug pa can dang gnod pa can gyi ling+ga byas la /
translated: When applying it to action, make a li·πÖga of a wicked or harmful person.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa pho nya spros nas ma rungs pa bkug nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa pho nya spros nas ma rungs pa bkug nas /
translated: Emanate the messenger, the emanation of the buddhas, and summon the wicked one.

original: ming dang bcas pa'i sngags bzla zhing sha lnga bdud rtsi lnga za zhing gcer bu skra grol ba lus kyi spyod pa lcags kyu dang zhags pa lag pas bzung nas sngags khri phrag stong bzlas na khams gsum po yang gsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang bcas pa'i sngags bzla zhing sha lnga bdud rtsi lnga za zhing gcer bu skra grol ba lus kyi spyod pa lcags kyu dang zhags pa lag pas bzung nas sngags khri phrag stong bzlas na khams gsum po yang gsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Recite the mantra with the name, eat the five meats and five elixirs, be naked, let the hair down, and with the conduct of the body, holding a hook and a noose in the hands, if one recites the mantra a thousand times ten of thousands, even the three realms will be killed.

original: yang na mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa drug 'khor gyis bskor bar bsams la thams cad kyang rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i khro bo dgra bo'i snying du zhugs nas snying dang rgyu ma la sogs pa drangs nas za bar byed par bsams nas zhag bdun gyi nyi ma phyed
analyzed: yang na mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa drug 'khor gyis bskor bar bsams la thams cad kyang rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i khro bo dgra bo'i snying du zhugs nas snying dang rgyu ma la sogs pa drangs nas za bar byed par bsams nas zhag bdun gyi nyi ma phyed
translated: Or else, one should imagine that the thirty-six dakinis are surrounded by a retinue, and that all of them, as Vajradaka, enter into the heart of the enemy, and having drawn out the heart, intestines, and so forth, they eat them.

original: dang mtshan phyed na kha lhor bltas nas tsher ma can gyi me la h'um phat ram ram zhes bya ba'i sngags zlos shing /
analyzed: dang mtshan phyed na kha lhor bltas nas tsher ma can gyi me la h'um phat ram ram zhes bya ba'i sngags zlos shing /
translated: Having imagined this, at noon and midnight of the seven days, facing south, one should recite the mantra ‚Äúhum phat ram ram‚Äù in the fire of thorns.

original: mar ngo'i bcu bzhi la sbyin sreg byas na rdo rje 'dzin pa brgya byin yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mar ngo'i bcu bzhi la sbyin sreg byas na rdo rje 'dzin pa brgya byin yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one performs the homa on the fourteenth of the waning phase, even Vajrapani, the lord of the gods, will die.üîΩIf he becomes a subject and goes for refuge, one should perform a pacifying homa in a milk tree.

original: rang la 'bangs byas skyabs su song na 'o ma can gyi shing la zhi ba'i sbyin sreg bya ba ni @229b go sla'o //
analyzed: rang la 'bangs byas skyabs su song na 'o ma can gyi shing la zhi ba'i sbyin sreg bya ba ni @229b go sla'o //
translated: This is easy to understand.

original: le'u drug cu rtsa lnga pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u drug cu rtsa lnga pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the sixty-fifth chapter of the Secret General Tantra, the Yoga of the Yoginis.

original: // / gal te tshe 'di la bsnyen pa byas kyang ma grub na rten 'brel gyi mthu skye ba bdun pa'i shas 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: // / gal te tshe 'di la bsnyen pa byas kyang ma grub na rten 'brel gyi mthu skye ba bdun pa'i shas 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not accomplish the rite of approach in this life, one will accomplish it in seven lives through the power of dependent origination.

original: de nas yang dag bshad bya ba //
analyzed: de nas yang dag bshad bya ba //
translated: Now, the true explanation of the rite of accomplishment

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: is stated.

original: skye ba bdun pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: skye ba bdun pa'i mtshan nyid ni /

analyzed: lha'i gzugs can ni rtags dang po'o //

analyzed: snyan par smra ba gnyis pa /

analyzed: gsum pa bde bar gshegs la dga' ba /

original: bzhi pa skra ring pa /
analyzed: bzhi pa skra ring pa /

original: lnga pa mig dkyus ring ba /
analyzed: lnga pa mig dkyus ring ba /

original: drug pa mig padma lta bu /
analyzed: drug pa mig padma lta bu /

analyzed: bdun pa rdul dri zhim pa dang / brgyad pa glang po'i dri yod pa /
translated: The seventh is a fragrant body. The eighth is the smell of an elephant.

original: dgu pa ga bur gyi dri yod pa /
analyzed: dgu pa ga bur gyi dri yod pa /

analyzed: bcu pa bshad gci gla rtsi'i dri yod pa /

analyzed: bcu gcig pa tshig 'jam pa /

analyzed: bcu gnyis pa lag pa rkang pa 'jam pa /

original: bcu gsum pa autpala'i dri yod pa /
analyzed: bcu gsum pa autpala'i dri yod pa /

original: bcu bzhi pa skra dkar dang gnyer ma med pa /
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa skra dkar dang gnyer ma med pa /
translated: The fourteenth is being free from gray hair and wrinkles.

original: bco lnga pa lus mdangs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bco lnga pa lus mdangs dang ldan pa /
translated: The fifteenth is having a radiant body.

original: bcu drug pa snying dang glad pa ni gi'u wang yod pa /
analyzed: bcu drug pa snying dang glad pa ni gi'u wang yod pa /
translated: The sixteenth is the heart and brain, which is the gu·πá·∏ça.

analyzed: bcu bdun pa grib ma bdun yod pa /

original: bco brgyad pa ngang pa'i 'gros su 'gro ba /
analyzed: bco brgyad pa ngang pa'i 'gros su 'gro ba /

original: bcu dgu pa snying rje can /
analyzed: bcu dgu pa snying rje can /

analyzed: nyi shu pa dkon mchog gsum la dad pa /

analyzed: rtags nyi shu rtsa gcig pa pha rol du phyin pa drug dang ldan pa de lta bu rnal 'byor pas rtogs na /

analyzed: de la phyi rtags dus ma yin par 'chi ba brgyad kyis mi tshugs seng ge dang stag dang sbyang gis mi za des mtshan mo mthong la nyin mo mi snang /

analyzed: de lta bu rtogs nas khyod grongs na bdag la khyed kyi lus sbyin par mdzad du gsol zhes blang bar bya'o //

analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pas bdud rtsi lnga lcags gsum gyis dkris pa khar bcug nas yab yum gyi snying po lhar bskyed dbang po sbyangs nas nye ba'i snying po 'bum bzlas na de 'chi ba'i tshe ro lag tu byin nas mi 'khrugs pa'i zhing khams su skye'o //
translated: Then, the yogin, having placed in his mouth the five ambrosias wrapped in the three metals, having generated the essence of the father and mother as deities, having purified the sense faculties, and having recited the quintessence one hundred thousand times, at the time of death, having given the corpse into his hand, he is born in the realm of Ak·π£obhya.

original: de nas dben pa'i gnas su khyer nas bdud rtsi'i bsgrub pa byas na dngos grub thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dben pa'i gnas su khyer nas bdud rtsi'i bsgrub pa byas na dngos grub thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having taken it to an isolated place, if one performs the accomplishment of ambrosia, all powers will arise.

original: skye ba bdun skra dang dud 'gro'i spu bsres nas srad bu byas nas mgul du bcings na de'i gzugs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: skye ba bdun skra dang dud 'gro'i spu bsres nas srad bu byas nas mgul du bcings na de'i gzugs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Having mixed the hair of one born seven times with animal hair, having made a thread, and having bound it around one's neck, one will become in that form.

original: de'i gi wang zos na lus 'dir rang dang lhan cig tu khams gsum gyi rgyal por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba las tshogs lnga bcu pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i gi wang zos na lus 'dir rang dang lhan cig tu khams gsum gyi rgyal por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba las tshogs lnga bcu pa yin no //
translated: Having eaten his bile, one will become a king of the three realms in this body together with him.üîΩThis is the fifty-first chapter of the Karma Collection.

original: le'u drug cu rtsa drug pa'i 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: le'u drug cu rtsa drug pa'i 'grel ba'o /
translated: Chapter Sixty-Six

original: // / rtsa ba'i rgyud rnams las zhi khro tshang bar 'gyur @230a * //
analyzed: // / rtsa ba'i rgyud rnams las zhi khro tshang bar 'gyur @230a * //
translated: The root tantras contain both peaceful and wrathful deities.üîΩ

original: ba'i phyir / zhi ba'i lha gang dang gang yin shes par bya ba dang de la mos pa'i ched du zhi ba sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i dkyil 'khor ston pa ni /
analyzed: ba'i phyir / zhi ba'i lha gang dang gang yin shes par bya ba dang de la mos pa'i ched du zhi ba sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i dkyil 'khor ston pa ni /
translated: In order to know which deities are peaceful and which are wrathful, and in order to have devotion to them, the peaceful Magical Net mandala is taught.üîΩNext, I will explain

analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Now, moreover, I will explainüîΩthe characteristics of the signs of the body.üîΩ

analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i cho gas sngon 'gro lnga dang / 'byung ba bzhi ri rab sna tshogs rdo rjer gyur pa las gzhal yas khang gi dbus su rang gi chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge las drod gsher skyes kyi lha bdag med pa'i chos kyi snang ba bsgom mo //

analyzed: bam las ni gtso bo rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom mo // shar sangs rgyas mkha' 'gro //

translated: The intermediate-direction forms such as Vajrar≈´pa hold the vases in the southeast and so forth.
