original: ro rdo rje mas byang shar gyi bum pa gzung /
analyzed: ro rdo rje mas byang shar gyi bum pa gzung /
translated: Taste Vajrƒ´ holds the vase in the northeast.

original: @230b reg rdo rje mas gtso bo rdo rje sems dpa' gzung /
analyzed: @230b reg rdo rje mas gtso bo rdo rje sems dpa' gzung /
translated: Touch Vajrƒ´ holds the principal Vajrasattva.

original: yum chos kyi dbyings lngas thabs ye shes lnga gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: yum chos kyi dbyings lngas thabs ye shes lnga gzung ba yin no //
translated: The five mothers of the realm of reality hold the five gnoses of method.

original: las kyi rgyal mchog ni go cha bskon ye shes sems dpa' gzhug //
analyzed: las kyi rgyal mchog ni go cha bskon ye shes sems dpa' gzhug //
translated: The supreme lord of action is the armoring, the introduction to the gnosis being,

original: dbang bskur bdud rtsi myang /
analyzed: dbang bskur bdud rtsi myang /
translated: the empowerment conferral, and the tasting of elixir.

original: bsgom pa dang bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: One should perform the meditation and recitation.

original: de'i don ni /
analyzed: de'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of that is:

original: ye shes sems dpa' gnyis med gzhug //üîΩrnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' gnyis med gzhug // rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
translated: The introduction to the nondual gnosis beingüîΩfollows the yoga tantra

original: rnal 'byor ma dbang rtogs par bya //üîΩzhes pa yin no //üîΩrgyud 'bum pa rig pa'i rgya mtsho zhes grags pa de la dpa' bo rnams rgyas par bshad pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma dbang rtogs par bya // zhes pa yin no // rgyud 'bum pa rig pa'i rgya mtsho zhes grags pa de la dpa' bo rnams rgyas par bshad pa /
translated: and should be understood from the empowerment of yoginƒ´s.üîΩThat is renowned as the ocean of the knowledge of the hundred thousand tantras.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The heroes explain it extensively, and it is summarized in this root tantra.

original: gzhung lugs sna tshogs bzang po 'di la bshad pa'i rgyud bzhi yod de /
analyzed: gzhung lugs sna tshogs bzang po 'di la bshad pa'i rgyud bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four explanatory tantras for this excellent system of various scriptures.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang sgyu ma bde mchog dang / rnal 'byor ma 'byung ba'i rgyud dang gsang ba'i rgyud do //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang sgyu ma bde mchog dang / rnal 'byor ma 'byung ba'i rgyud dang gsang ba'i rgyud do //
translated: They are the Vajradaka, the Mayajala, the Yoginisambhara, and the Guhyatantra.

original: nges brjod bla ma rgyud de dag gis rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi man ngag sems can bsam pa'i khyad par gang la mos pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nges brjod bla ma rgyud de dag gis rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi man ngag sems can bsam pa'i khyad par gang la mos pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Those tantras of definitive expression are the pith instructions of the root tantra, which are for the sake of guiding those who have the disposition of a sentient being, according to their various aspirations.

original: gzhung lugs sna tshogs kyi man ngag gis sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ster ro //
analyzed: gzhung lugs sna tshogs kyi man ngag gis sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ster ro //
translated: The pith instructions of the various scriptures bestow the enlightenment of buddhahood.

original: dbus kyi 'khor lo la rigs lnga yab yum bcu thugs rdo rje phreng bas bskor /
analyzed: dbus kyi 'khor lo la rigs lnga yab yum bcu thugs rdo rje phreng bas bskor /
translated: The ten fathers and mothers of the five families in the central wheel are surrounded by the vajra garland of mind.

original: gsung padma'i phreng bas bskor /
analyzed: gsung padma'i phreng bas bskor /
translated: The garland of lotus of speech is surrounded by the garland of jewels of enlightened body.

original: sku 'khor lo'i phreng bas bskor ba'i rigs lnga dang byang chub sems dpa' du ma dang / khro bo brgyad dang / dkar mo la sogs pa brgyad kyis phyogs skyong brgyad mnan nas 'khor gyi mchog dang sgo dang mtshams su dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sku 'khor lo'i phreng bas bskor ba'i rigs lnga dang byang chub sems dpa' du ma dang / khro bo brgyad dang / dkar mo la sogs pa brgyad kyis phyogs skyong brgyad mnan nas 'khor gyi mchog dang sgo dang mtshams su dgod par bya'o //
translated: The body is surrounded by a garland of wheels, the five families, many bodhisattvas, the eight wrathful ones, and the eight such as white dakini, who trample on the eight directions.

original: sku mdog dang phyag mtshan rgyud na gsal bas go sla'o //üîΩnyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'i sangs rgyas dang mu stegs can la gsang ba dang / mchod pa dang bstod pa gtor ma gtang ba bla ma'i zhal nas sam /
analyzed: sku mdog dang phyag mtshan rgyud na gsal bas go sla'o // nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'i sangs rgyas dang mu stegs can la gsang ba dang / mchod pa dang bstod pa gtor ma gtang ba bla ma'i zhal nas sam /
translated: The colors and implements of the deities are easy to understand because they are clear in the tantra.

original: rmi lam du rnal 'byor ma'i drin gyis bstan nas /
analyzed: rmi lam du rnal 'byor ma'i drin gyis bstan nas /
translated: The secret of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, buddhas, and tƒ´rthikas, the offerings, praises, and torma offering should be taught by the guru or through the kindness of yoginƒ´s in dreams.

original: lha rnams kyi rnam dag sum cu rtsa drug bsgom pa dang / gnas bcu sa bcu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rtogs pa dang / dang po sbyor ba dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog las rgyal mchog gi sbyor ba gsum /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi rnam dag sum cu rtsa drug bsgom pa dang / gnas bcu sa bcu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rtogs pa dang / dang po sbyor ba dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog las rgyal mchog gi sbyor ba gsum /
translated: The meditation on the thirty-six pure deities, the realization of the ten places and ten stages, and the ten perfections, and the three: the initial union, the supreme king of ma·πá·∏çalas, and the supreme king of activities,

original: rnam par dag pa'i don dri ma med pa'i mchog bsgom pa ni mjug gi sngom pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i don dri ma med pa'i mchog bsgom pa ni mjug gi sngom pa yin no //
translated: The supreme stainless meditation on the meaning of purity is the conclusion.

original: le'u drug cu rtsa bdun pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u drug cu rtsa bdun pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the sixty-seventh chapter of the ‚ÄúClear Meaning Commentary on the Condensed Meaning of the Glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra.‚Äù

original: // / da ni /
analyzed: // / da ni /
translated: Now,

original: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor mchog tu bshad bya ba //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor mchog tu bshad bya ba // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the supreme mandala of the Victor is explained.

original: bdag nyid bsgom pa'i go cha'i rim pa zhes bya ba ni /üîΩsngon 'gro lnga dang 'byung ba @231a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid bsgom pa'i go cha'i rim pa zhes bya ba ni / sngon 'gro lnga dang 'byung ba @231a * //
translated: The ‚Äústages of the armor of self-consecration‚ÄùüîΩare the five preliminaries and the four elements becoming Mount Meru and a variegated vajra cross.üîΩFrom that, the celestial mansion arises.

original: bzhi ri rab sna tshogs rdo rjer gyur pa las gzhal yas khang de'i nang du so sor 'brang ma'i gzungs las 'byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: bzhi ri rab sna tshogs rdo rjer gyur pa las gzhal yas khang de'i nang du so sor 'brang ma'i gzungs las 'byung ba bzhin du /
translated: Inside that, as in the Dhvajagrakeyurasini DhƒÅra·πáƒ´,

original: gtso bo zhal lnga pa phyag sum cu rtsa gnyis la /
analyzed: gtso bo zhal lnga pa phyag sum cu rtsa gnyis la /
translated: the principal figure has five faces and thirty-two arms.

original: 'khor gyi lha mo m'a ma k'i dang / spyan ma dang / sgrol ma dang / gos dkar mo dang / 'od zer can dang / rmug 'dzin ma dang / skul byed ma dang / sa 'dzin ma dang brgyad ni zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa gtso bo rdo rje'i skyil mo krung /
analyzed: 'khor gyi lha mo m'a ma k'i dang / spyan ma dang / sgrol ma dang / gos dkar mo dang / 'od zer can dang / rmug 'dzin ma dang / skul byed ma dang / sa 'dzin ma dang brgyad ni zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa gtso bo rdo rje'i skyil mo krung /
translated: The eight goddesses of the retinue‚ÄîMamaki, Locana, Tara, Pandaravasini, Marichi, Varahi, Chandali, and Vasudhara‚Äîhave four faces and twelve arms. Meditate that they sit in the posture of the principal deity, the vajra posture,

original: 'khor sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs par bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'khor sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs par bsgom mo //
translated: while the retinue of bodhisattvas sit in the lotus posture.

original: yang na rang gi ming las byung ba'i khro bo brgyad shar sngo lho ser /
analyzed: yang na rang gi ming las byung ba'i khro bo brgyad shar sngo lho ser /
translated: Alternatively, the eight wrathful ones that arise from their own names are blue in the east, yellow in the south,

original: nub dmar byang ljang shar lho gang / lho nub dkar //
analyzed: nub dmar byang ljang shar lho gang / lho nub dkar //
translated: red in the west, green in the north, white in the southeast,

original: nub byang ser /
analyzed: nub byang ser /
translated: yellow in the northwest,üîΩand blue in the northeast. They have various forms, one face, and two arms.

original: byang shar sngo ba sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can ma zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa khro ba'i mchog 'byung po 'dul byed ni dbus su mig sman sngon po'i mdog can rdo rje dang sdigs mdzub na bza' sngon po stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can sprul gyis brgyan pa
analyzed: byang shar sngo ba sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can ma zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa khro ba'i mchog 'byung po 'dul byed ni dbus su mig sman sngon po'i mdog can rdo rje dang sdigs mdzub na bza' sngon po stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can sprul gyis brgyan pa
translated: The supreme wrathful one who tames all evil spirits is in the center. He is the color of blue dye, holds a vajra and makes a threatening gesture with the other hand, wears blue garments, and has a tiger-skin skirt. He is adorned with snakes.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i tshe yang zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i tshe yang zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Even when not in equipoise, one should meditate on the single-faced, two-armed form.

original: phra ba nang gi rdo rje can bsgom pa ni snying ga'i nu ma'i bar du khro bo dgu /
analyzed: phra ba nang gi rdo rje can bsgom pa ni snying ga'i nu ma'i bar du khro bo dgu /
translated: The meditation on the subtle inner vajra holders is the nine wrathful ones between the heart and the breasts.

original: gnas gsum du 'khor lo gsum gyi lhas 'gro ba gsum po dag par byas pa ni mchod pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gnas gsum du 'khor lo gsum gyi lhas 'gro ba gsum po dag par byas pa ni mchod pa dang po'o //
translated: The purification of the three migrations by the deities of the three wheels in the three places is the first offering.

original: gang gi rdo rje'i sbyor bas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i rdo rjes mchod pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi rdo rje'i sbyor bas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i rdo rjes mchod pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The offering with the five sense objects by the vajra union is the second.

original: mchod pa lnga me tog dang bdug pa la sogs pas mchod pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa lnga me tog dang bdug pa la sogs pas mchod pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The offering with the five offerings such as flowers is the third.

original: stong pa nyid bzhi yum bzhi mnyam pa nyid kyi mchod pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bzhi yum bzhi mnyam pa nyid kyi mchod pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The offering of the four emptinesses and four mothers is the fourth.

original: ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang / go cha bgo ba dang / dbang bskur ba dang / bdud rtsi myang ba dang / gtor ma gtang ba ni kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang / go cha bgo ba dang / dbang bskur ba dang / bdud rtsi myang ba dang / gtor ma gtang ba ni kha bskang ngo //
translated: The insertion of the wisdom being, donning the armor, conferring empowerment, tasting the elixir, and offering the bali are the supplements.

original: le'u drug cu rtsa brgyad pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u drug cu rtsa brgyad pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary to the sixty-eighth chapter.

original: // / lha'i 'khor lo sngar bshad pa rgyud 'bum pa las sngags dang de nyid rgyas par bstan /
analyzed: // / lha'i 'khor lo sngar bshad pa rgyud 'bum pa las sngags dang de nyid rgyas par bstan /
translated: The wheel of deities explained above is taught extensively in the Tantra in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas with its mantras and suchness.

original: rgyud 'dir mdor bstan pa'i lha'i 'khor lo ni don dam pa ma yin /
analyzed: rgyud 'dir mdor bstan pa'i lha'i 'khor lo ni don dam pa ma yin /
translated: The wheel of deities taught concisely in this tantra is not ultimate.

original: gal te don dam pa'i shes pa skyes na ston pa po dang bstan pa lha'i 'khor lo yang med do //
analyzed: gal te don dam pa'i shes pa skyes na ston pa po dang bstan pa lha'i 'khor lo yang med do //
translated: If the knowledge of the ultimate arises, there is no teacher, nor is there a wheel of deities that is taught.

original: 'o na su'i don du bstan zhen /
analyzed: 'o na su'i don du bstan zhen /
translated: For whose benefit, then, is it taught?

original: 'khor ba 'dir sgyu ma sdug bsngal can gyis skyes pa la lha nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i 'khor lo gnas dang bcas pa sgyu ma can bstan pa don dam pa'i bden par @231b ni ma yin no //üîΩgal te don dam par med na lha'i 'khor lo 'khrul pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'dir sgyu ma sdug bsngal can gyis skyes pa la lha nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i 'khor lo gnas dang bcas pa sgyu ma can bstan pa don dam pa'i bden par @231b ni ma yin no // gal te don dam par med na lha'i 'khor lo 'khrul pas ci zhig bya /
translated: For those born in this cyclic existence of suffering, the wheel of twenty-four deities with its abodes is taught as an illusion, but not as ultimate truth.üîΩIf it does not exist ultimately, what is the point of the wheel of deities, which is an illusion?

original: 'on te don dam pa'i ye shes la rnam pa lha'i 'khor lo yod na 'khrul pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te don dam pa'i ye shes la rnam pa lha'i 'khor lo yod na 'khrul pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If the ultimate pristine consciousness has the aspect of the wheel of deities, what is the delusion?

original: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pas sgyu ma sdug bsngal can spangs nas sgyu ma bde ba dri ma med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pas sgyu ma sdug bsngal can spangs nas sgyu ma bde ba dri ma med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having abandoned the suffering of the magical creation in the places, the neighboring places, and so on, the immaculate bliss of the magical creation will occur.

original: yang don dam pa'i bsgom pa mi nus pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la bag mad par spyod pa'i mi la thams cad lha'i 'khor lo byas nas gnas 'di bsgrags par bya'o //
analyzed: yang don dam pa'i bsgom pa mi nus pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la bag mad par spyod pa'i mi la thams cad lha'i 'khor lo byas nas gnas 'di bsgrags par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, for those who are unable to meditate on the ultimate, having created the divine wheel, this place should be proclaimed for those who enjoy the five sense objects without restraint.

original: ngas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo du ma bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ngas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo du ma bshad pa ni /
translated: I have explained many ma·πá·∏çala wheels.

original: sems can bsam pa sna tshogs yod pas bsam gtan gyi bde bar bsgom pa'i phyir lha'i 'khor lo bshad do //
analyzed: sems can bsam pa sna tshogs yod pas bsam gtan gyi bde bar bsgom pa'i phyir lha'i 'khor lo bshad do //
translated: Since there are various thoughts among sentient beings, I have explained the divine wheel for the sake of meditating on the bliss of concentration.

original: rnal 'byor pa phyi rol gyi zhing rmo ba dang / tshong bya ba dang / phyugs bskyang ba dang / spyod lam rnam bzhi sdug bsngal bas khams zad par 'gyur ba la de spangs nas snod kyi 'jig rten gzhal yas khang 'gro ba rigs drug lha'i 'khor lo 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas mchod pa'i rol pas gnas pa'i rnal 'byor can /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa phyi rol gyi zhing rmo ba dang / tshong bya ba dang / phyugs bskyang ba dang / spyod lam rnam bzhi sdug bsngal bas khams zad par 'gyur ba la de spangs nas snod kyi 'jig rten gzhal yas khang 'gro ba rigs drug lha'i 'khor lo 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas mchod pa'i rol pas gnas pa'i rnal 'byor can /
translated: The yogi who has abandoned the suffering of farming, trading, tending cattle, and the four types of daily activity, who abides in the yoga of the immeasurable palace of the world and the six types of migrating beings as the offering of the five sense offerings,

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi spyan lngas gzigs nas ci 'dod pa'i dngos grub mtha' yas ba'i dngos grub stsol lo //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi spyan lngas gzigs nas ci 'dod pa'i dngos grub mtha' yas ba'i dngos grub stsol lo //
translated: is seen by the five eyes of the buddhas and is granted the siddhi of infinite desired siddhis.

original: don dam par med kyang kun rdzob tu bsod nams kyi tshogs bsgom pa bshad nas /
analyzed: don dam par med kyang kun rdzob tu bsod nams kyi tshogs bsgom pa bshad nas /
translated: Although ultimately nonexistent, the accumulation of merit is explained as being cultivated conventionally.

original: brtan pa thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa des rje btsun gyi ye shes la 'bad de bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: brtan pa thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa des rje btsun gyi ye shes la 'bad de bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The yogi who has attained stability should strive in the gnosis of the transcendent conqueror and accomplish it.

original: ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how is that done,

original: lha sna tshogs kyi mdzad pa dang ldan pa'i lus po lha'i chad byad bya /
analyzed: lha sna tshogs kyi mdzad pa dang ldan pa'i lus po lha'i chad byad bya /
translated: the body endowed with the deeds of various deities should be adorned with the ornaments of the deity.

original: gang yang rung ba'i kha zad bdud rtsir bsam /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i kha zad bdud rtsir bsam /
translated: Whatever food one eats, think of it as nectar.

original: nyal ba gcer bu'am ma nyal ba gos dang bcas pa rang gi lha'i rnam pa'i nga rgyal bya /
analyzed: nyal ba gcer bu'am ma nyal ba gos dang bcas pa rang gi lha'i rnam pa'i nga rgyal bya /
translated: When sleeping, do it naked, or when not sleeping, with clothes, and do it with the pride of one‚Äôs deity.

original: lkugs pa bzhin du mi smra bar bzlas pa byas na zla drug gis lha gang 'dod pa gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lkugs pa bzhin du mi smra bar bzlas pa byas na zla drug gis lha gang 'dod pa gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does the recitation without speaking like a mute, in six months whatever deity one desires will appear.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi spyod pa dang rtul zhugs bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi spyod pa dang rtul zhugs bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the conduct and observances of all ma·πá·∏çalas,

original: phan yon gyi mngon par shes pa skyes nas padma'i rdzing bu lta bu'i rnal 'byor pa la dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams ngang pa'i tshogs bzhin du 'du ba dang / yid mig 'phrul mkhan sgyu mkhan ltar 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa 'khor dang bcas pa mngon sum du mthong bar the tshom med do //üîΩphan yon bshad nas /
analyzed: phan yon gyi mngon par shes pa skyes nas padma'i rdzing bu lta bu'i rnal 'byor pa la dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams ngang pa'i tshogs bzhin du 'du ba dang / yid mig 'phrul mkhan sgyu mkhan ltar 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa 'khor dang bcas pa mngon sum du mthong bar the tshom med do // phan yon bshad nas /
translated: since the higher cognitions arise as benefits, there is no doubt that yogins and yoginƒ´s, like a lotus pond, will gather like a flock of geese, and the vajra holder who benefits migrating beings like a magician or an illusionist will be seen in actuality with his retinue.üîΩHaving explained the benefits,

original: gdams ngag ston pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i @232a * //
analyzed: gdams ngag ston pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i @232a * //
translated: the instruction is as follows:

original: dkyil 'khor 'di la nges par sna gtad nas dad pa skad cig tsam bshad pa nyan pas sems dga' bar gyis shig ces gsol ba 'debs so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'di la nges par sna gtad nas dad pa skad cig tsam bshad pa nyan pas sems dga' bar gyis shig ces gsol ba 'debs so //
translated: Having definitely directed one's nose to this mandala, one should delight one's mind by listening to the explanation of faith for even a moment.

original: dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug gi thams cad ldan pa'i tshe rdo rje drag po h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i snying gar sngags bkod pa la 'od zer lcags kyu lta bu'i sbyor bas lus kyi dkyil 'khor sngags la bsdus nas sngags chos kyi dbyings sems
analyzed: dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug gi thams cad ldan pa'i tshe rdo rje drag po h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i snying gar sngags bkod pa la 'od zer lcags kyu lta bu'i sbyor bas lus kyi dkyil 'khor sngags la bsdus nas sngags chos kyi dbyings sems
translated: When all the fifty-six mandalas are complete, one should arrange the mantra at the heart of the union with the fierce Vajra Humkara, and by the yoga of light rays like hooks, one should gather the body mandala into the mantra, and the mantra into the mind wheel of the dharmadhatu.

original: kyi 'khor lo chos kyi dbyings su brtag go //
analyzed: kyi 'khor lo chos kyi dbyings su brtag go //
translated: One should investigate the mind in the dharmadhatu.

original: rang gi chos kyi yi ge go cha drug gis skye mched drug gzung 'dzin dang bral bar bsgom mo //
analyzed: rang gi chos kyi yi ge go cha drug gis skye mched drug gzung 'dzin dang bral bar bsgom mo //
translated: One should meditate on one's own dharma syllable as the six sense bases free from subject and object.

original: ji ltar lha'i 'khor lo rtag pa'i snying gar bsdus nas /
analyzed: ji ltar lha'i 'khor lo rtag pa'i snying gar bsdus nas /
translated: Just as the wheel of deities is gathered into the heart of the eternal one,

original: thun mtshams su zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa gzhan gyi gzugs su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: thun mtshams su zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa gzhan gyi gzugs su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: in the session breaks one should meditate on the form of another with one face and two arms.

original: sems yid gti mug pa mos pa mtha' yas pa la gzugs sna tshogs su bstan par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems yid gti mug pa mos pa mtha' yas pa la gzugs sna tshogs su bstan par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The mind, intellect, and delusion should be seen as the display of various forms for those with limitless interest.

original: le'u drug cu rtsa dgu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u drug cu rtsa dgu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the sixty-ninth chapter of the tantra.

original: // / rang bzhin med pa'i chos rnam zhes pa'i tshigs bcad gcig ni rgyud brjod bya'o //üîΩrgyud rdzogs pa yis sbyor ba yin //
analyzed: // / rang bzhin med pa'i chos rnam zhes pa'i tshigs bcad gcig ni rgyud brjod bya'o // rgyud rdzogs pa yis sbyor ba yin //
translated: The single verse beginning with ‚ÄúThe phenomena of non-inherent existence‚Äù is the recitation of the tantra.

original: zhes pa tshigs bcad gcig gis ni rgyu'i rgyud la rjes su yi rangs shing bstod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa tshigs bcad gcig gis ni rgyu'i rgyud la rjes su yi rangs shing bstod pa'o //
translated: The single verse beginning with ‚ÄúThe union of the complete tantra‚Äù is the praise and rejoicing in the cause tantra.

analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub dka' drin mchog / ces pa'i tshigs bcad phyed ni thabs kyi rgyud la bstod pa'o // sgrub pa'i bla ma'i bla ma ste //
translated: The half-verse beginning with ‚ÄúThe Buddha‚Äôs awakening, supreme kindness‚Äù is the praise of the method tantra.

analyzed: zhes pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis ni 'bras bu'i rgyud la bstod pa'o // legs so rdo rje'i bla ma kun //
translated: The two verses beginning with ‚ÄúThe guru of the guru of practice‚Äù are the praise of the result tantra.

analyzed: zhes pa tshigs bcad gcig gis rgyud 'bum pa 'chad pa'i gtso bo dang 'khor la bstod pa'o //

analyzed: le'u bdun bcu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
